brand.$description: Use it to represent the brand color in interface elements, icons, borders, illustrations, and more. (btn blue 44 and 48

purple.$description: Use accent-purple to highlight elements on light neutral surfaces when the color carries no semantic meaning or status. Ideal for decorative borders or foreground elements.

yellow.$description: Use accent-yellow to highlight elements on light neutral surfaces when the color carries no semantic meaning or status. Ideal for decorative borders or foreground elements.

success.$description: Use it to communicate a favorable outcome, such as a success message in an input field or a border on a neutral surface.

warning.$description: Use it to emphasize caution, such as in warning text or borders on neutral surfaces.

error.$description: Use it in critical contexts, such as error messages or borders on neutral surfaces.

info.$description: Use it to communicate a previous state to continue, or that something is in progress â€” such as validations, loading states, or progress bars
